Class StaticExchangeEvaluator

java.lang.Object
engine.forPlayer.forAI.StaticExchangeEvaluator
public class StaticExchangeEvaluator extends Object
The StaticExchangeEvaluator class implements Static Exchange Evaluation (SEE) for accurate assessment of capture sequences in chess positions. SEE recursively evaluates the best possible outcome of a capture sequence for each side, providing critical information for move ordering and pruning decisions in search algorithms. This evaluation helps distinguish between profitable and unprofitable exchanges.

The class follows the singleton pattern to ensure consistent evaluation across the chess engine. It uses simplified piece values optimized for exchange calculations and considers factors such as piece defense and attack sequences to determine the material outcome of captures.

Author:
Aaron Ho

  • Field Details

    • INSTANCE

      private static final StaticExchangeEvaluator INSTANCE
      The singleton instance of the StaticExchangeEvaluator for global access.

    • SEE_PIECE_VALUES

      private static final int[] SEE_PIECE_VALUES
      Simplified piece values used for SEE calculations, indexed by piece type ordinal. Values are optimized for exchange evaluation rather than full position assessment.

  • Constructor Details

    • StaticExchangeEvaluator

      private StaticExchangeEvaluator()
      Constructs a new StaticExchangeEvaluator instance. Private constructor enforces the singleton pattern.

  • Method Details

    • get

      public static StaticExchangeEvaluator get()
      Returns the singleton instance of the StaticExchangeEvaluator.
      Returns:
      The singleton StaticExchangeEvaluator instance.

    • evaluate

      public int evaluate(Board board, Move move)
      Evaluates the material gain or loss from a capture move using static exchange evaluation. The method simulates the optimal capture sequence for both sides and returns the expected material outcome. Non-capture moves return a value of zero.
      Parameters:
      board - The current chess board state.
      move - The capture move to evaluate.
      Returns:
      The estimated material gain or loss, positive values favor the side making the initial capture.

    • isPieceDefended

      public boolean isPieceDefended(Piece piece, Board board)
      Determines whether a piece is defended by any other piece of the same alliance. This method provides an efficient check for piece defense without full attack calculation.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to check for defense.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      True if the piece is defended by a friendly piece, false otherwise.

    • findAttackers

      private List<Piece> findAttackers(Board board, int targetSquare)
      Finds all pieces that can attack a specific square on the board. This method examines all pieces and their legal moves to determine attack capabilities.
      Parameters:
      board - The current chess board state.
      targetSquare - The square coordinate to check for attackers.
      Returns:
      A list of pieces that can attack the target square.

    • findLeastValuableAttacker

      private Piece findLeastValuableAttacker(List<Piece> attackers, Alliance side)
      Finds the least valuable attacking piece of a given alliance from the list of attackers. This method implements the principle of using the lowest-value piece for exchanges.
      Parameters:
      attackers - The list of pieces that can attack the target square.
      side - The alliance of the attacking side.
      Returns:
      The least valuable attacker of the specified side, or null if none found.

    • getPieceValue

      private int getPieceValue(Piece.PieceType pieceType)
      Returns the SEE-specific value for a given piece type. These values are optimized for exchange evaluation calculations.
      Parameters:
      pieceType - The type of piece to evaluate.
      Returns:
      The SEE value for the piece type.
